intro: Nauclea microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed nauclea, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Nauclea microcephala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
